channel.title: The Ark
channel.description: The Ark is the weekly newspaper of Tiburon, Belvedere and Strawberry

item.title: New Blanding Lane home with expansive views lists for nearly $30 million
item.description: The three-story house at 1 Blanding Lane went on sale March 15 with an asking price of $29.9 million.
item.dc:creator: Naomi Friedland

item.title: Diversity task force appoints its vice chair to police panel
item.description: The Tiburon Diversity Inclusion Task Force has tapped Vice Chair Tina Shah Paikeday as its new representative on the police chief’s...
item.dc:creator: Francisco Martinez

item.title: Everyday Encounters: A massage therapist enjoys the peaceful surroundings
item.description: Lauren Gravell, the owner of Belvedere Island Spa in downtown Tiburon, says her career in massage therapy came about by chance.
item.dc:creator: Naomi Friedland

item.title: Tiburon plans repairs of Ark Row seawall along cove
item.description: It’s just feet from Belvedere’s own stretch of Beach Road seawall that’s failing from erosion and targeted for $3 million in repairs.
item.dc:creator: Francisco Martinez

item.title: Marin housing advocates highlight crisis and potential solutions at library event
item.description: Representatives outlined Marin’s history of exclusionary zoning, slow development and preservation policies.
item.dc:creator: Naomi Friedland

item.title: Tiburon wants to fast-track some simpler parks projects
item.description: Play structures, signs and trailheads are part of town’s new master plan.
item.dc:creator: Francisco Martinez

item.title: Reed school district to poll voter support for facilities bond
item.description: The Reed Union School District will gauge voter support for a potential November 2026 bond measure that would generate funding for...
item.dc:creator: Emily Lavin

item.title: Tiburon adds Nowruz, Diwali festivals to Main Street closures
item.description: The events mark the sixth and seventh street closures for festivals — one more than agreed upon under a compromise with local businesses.
item.dc:creator: Francisco Martinez

item.title: ‘Marin County Jane Doe,’ whose body was found in Tiburon in 1966, has been identified
item.description: The body of 'Marin County Jane Doe,' found in Tiburon in 1966, has been identified.
item.dc:creator: Kevin Hessel
